特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
If you need to contact me, please do so at andrew.kgu@gmail.com
Depending on enrollment numbers, the evolving COVID-19 situation, and the schedule of students at Trinity University, this course should be mostly face to face, with a hybrid, online option, if needed. Most classes will involve a lecture component followed by whole-class and small-group discussions. Groups will sometimes be asked to make impromptu speeches to summarize the contents of discussion. The final few classes of the semester will be dedicated to student presentations. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. The course will also involve at least two LIVE online sessions with students at Trinity University.

第1回:
**The course contents are subject to change dependent on the information received from the students' needs analyses. The needs analyses will be done during the first class of the semester.
Icebreakers: Students get to know each other and learn about the course and the background of the US-based students; Learn about the COIL activity #1 self-intro video assignment

In principle, all 14 sessions will be conducted face to face
Needs analysis survey: 1 hour
self-intro video: 1 hour
第2回: View Trinity student self-intros; make comments; prepare COIL activity #2 (a day in my life)
Make comments and complete "a day in my life" video: 2-3 hours
第3回: Synchronous Zoom class with Trinity students (COIL activity #3), discussing “a day in the life” videos
Prepare for first LIVE Zoom: 1 hour
第4回: Final COIL activities #4 and #5: short video on team-chosen cultural topic and synchronous Zoom class with Trinity students
Final cultural-content video and second Zoom preparation: 3-4 hours
第5回: Written reflection and small-team discussions about COIL. Introduce the Autobiography of Intercultural Encounters (AIE)
第6回: Reflections on identity development through COIL; Who am I?
第7回: AIE section 1; discussion on stereotypes, prejudice, and discrimination
第8回: AIE sections 2 and 3; discussion on empathy
第9回: AIE sections 4 and 5; discussion on nonverbal communication
第11回: AIE sections 6 and 7; deep culture podcast “Beyond the dos and don'ts”
第12回: AIE sections 8 and 9; discussion on cross-cultural etiquette
第13回: Prepare and deliver final presentation: 10-15 hours (approximately)
